content:
I installed elan fresh from nixpkgs, followed the instructions to get started with mathematics_in_lean, and it explodes spectacularly:

[~/dev/math]$ git clone https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathematics_in_lean.git
Cloning into 'mathematics_in_lean'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 2916, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (1425/1425), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (260/260), done.
remote: Total 2916 (delta 1296), reused 1165 (delta 1165), pack-reused 1491 (from 2)
Receiving objects: 100% (2916/2916), 51.64 MiB | 48.03 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (2018/2018), done.

[~/dev/math]$ cd mathematics_in_lean/

[master][~/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean]$ lake exe cache get

Total: 347.4 MiB Speed:  57.8 MiB/s

error: /home/brian/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean/.lake/packages/mathlib/lakefile.lean:28:48: expected token

error: /home/brian/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean/.lake/packages/mathlib/lakefile.lean:158:2: unexpected identifier; expected 'abbrev', 'add_decl_doc', 'axiom', 'binder_predicate', 'builtin_initialize', 'class', 'declare_syntax_cat', 'def', 'elab', 'elab_rules', 'example', 'inductive', 'infix', 'infixl', 'infixr', 'initialize', 'instance', 'macro', 'macro_rules', 'notation', 'opaque', 'postfix', 'prefix', 'recommended_spelling', 'register_tactic_tag', 'structure', 'syntax', 'tactic_extension' or 'theorem'
error: /home/brian/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean/.lake/packages/mathlib/lakefile.lean:175:2: unexpected identifier; expected 'abbrev', 'add_decl_doc', 'axiom', 'binder_predicate', 'builtin_initialize', 'class', 'declare_syntax_cat', 'def', 'elab', 'elab_rules', 'example', 'inductive', 'infix', 'infixl', 'infixr', 'initialize', 'instance', 'macro', 'macro_rules', 'notation', 'opaque', 'postfix', 'prefix', 'recommended_spelling', 'register_tactic_tag', 'structure', 'syntax', 'tactic_extension' or 'theorem'
error: /home/brian/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean/.lake/packages/mathlib/lakefile.lean: package configuration has errors
Does anyone know how to get elan working on NixOS?

is that the elan from nixpkgs? Are you on 25.05? elan works fine for me on 25.05, but also when it's failed in the past the errors don't look like that, in your case it looks like elan does its job at getting the current lean version and something else fails
(also works with a fresh clone of mathematics_in_lean, just tried it)

mathematics_in_lean git:(master) lake exe cache get
Mathlib repository: leanprover-community/mathlib4
No files to download
Decompressing 6772 file(s)
Unpacked in 14188 ms
Completed successfully!
  mathematics_in_lean git:(master) which elan
/run/current-system/sw/bin/elan
  mathematics_in_lean git:(master) elan --version
elan 4.1.1
  mathematics_in_lean git:(master) cat /etc/os-release
ANSI_COLOR="0;38;2;126;186;228"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues"
BUILD_ID="25.05.802491.7c43f080a7f2"
CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:nixos:nixos:25.05"
DEFAULT_HOSTNAME=nixos
DOCUMENTATION_URL="https://nixos.org/learn.html"
HOME_URL="https://nixos.org/"
ID=nixos
ID_LIKE=""
IMAGE_ID=""
IMAGE_VERSION=""
LOGO="nix-snowflake"
NAME=NixOS
PRETTY_NAME="NixOS 25.05 (Warbler)"
SUPPORT_END="2025-12-31"
SUPPORT_URL="https://nixos.org/community.html"
VARIANT=""
VARIANT_ID=""
VENDOR_NAME=NixOS
VENDOR_URL="https://nixos.org/"
VERSION="25.05 (Warbler)"
VERSION_CODENAME=warbler
VERSION_ID="25.05"
@Andrs Goens Im on unstable, actually. Ill try the 25.05 package
Nope, same error. I suppose that's expected... it's only elan 4.1.1 vs 4.1.2.

It's a pretty weird error, because it looks like you're getting the wrong version of Lean event though elan installed it. What's the output of lean --version and lake --version inside the mathematics_in_lean directory?

[master][~/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean]$ lean --version
Lean (version 4.20.0, x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu, commit 77cfc4d1a4f6, Release)

[master][~/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean]$ lake --version
Lake version 5.0.0-77cfc4d (Lean version 4.20.0)
It's specifically complaining about the mathlib lakefile it seems... not sure if that's helpful
And what's the output of "lake --verbose exe cache get"?
It doesn't seem to print anything additional; same error.

Ok, fair. It seems like your ~/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4---v4.20.0directory might be incomplete for some reason. Do you have a ~/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4---v4.20.0/src/lean/lake/Lake directory? Do you have any unusual characters in your home directory path?

[master][~/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean]$ pwd
/home/brian/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean

[master][~/dev/math/mathematics_in_lean]$ ls -la ~/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4---v4.20.0/src/lean/lake/Lake
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 Build
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 CLI
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 Config
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 DSL
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 Load
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 Toml
drwxr-xr-x    - brian  4 Jul 09:50 Util
.rw-r--r--  327 brian  2 Jun 07:50 Build.lean
.rw-r--r--  175 brian  2 Jun 07:50 CLI.lean
.rw-r--r--  179 brian  2 Jun 07:50 Config.lean
.rw-r--r--  415 brian  2 Jun 07:50 DSL.lean
.rw-r--r--  181 brian  2 Jun 07:50 Load.lean
.rw-r--r-- 7.7k brian  2 Jun 07:50 Reservoir.lean
.rw-r--r--  176 brian  2 Jun 07:50 Toml.lean
.rw-r--r--  734 brian  2 Jun 07:50 Version.lean
Doesn't seem suspicious
No special characters
Did you use non-nixpkgs elan before installing elan from nixpkgs? I have no idea what's going on.
Last question: You do have .olean files in ~/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4---v4.20.0/lib/lean/Lake, right?

Nope. I just tried making a brand new project and that also fails... this time with "too many open files."

[~/dev/math]$ lake new test
info: downloading https://github.com/leanprover/lean4-nightly/releases/download/nightly-2025-07-04/lean-4.23.0-nightly-2025-07-04-linux.tar.zst
Total: 377.5 MiB Speed:  56.7 MiB/s
info: installing /home/brian/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4-nightly---nightly-2025-07-04

[~/dev/math]$ cd test/

[master][~/dev/math/test]$ lake build
info: test: no previous manifest, creating one from scratch
info: toolchain not updated; already up-to-date
 [2/8] Building Test.Basic
trace: .> LEAN_PATH=/home/brian/dev/math/test/.lake/build/lib/lean /home/brian/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4-nightly---nightly-2025-07-04/bin/lean /home/brian/dev/math/test/Test/Basic.lean -o /home/brian/dev/math/test/.lake/build/lib/lean/Test/Basic.olean -i /home/brian/dev/math/test/.lake/build/lib/lean/Test/Basic.ilean -c /home/brian/dev/math/test/.lake/build/ir/Test/Basic.c --setup /home/brian/dev/math/test/.lake/build/ir/Test/Basic.setup.json --json
error: Test/Basic.lean:1:0: failed to open '/home/brian/.elan/toolchains/leanprover--lean4-nightly---nightly-2025-07-04/lib/lean/Init/Data/Slice/Array/Iterator.olean.private': Too many open files
error: Lean exited with code 1
Some required builds logged failures:
- Test.Basic
error: build failed
The only nix-specific thing I found was https://github.com/nix-community/impermanence/issues/206, but I assume your / is not on tmpfs (and your /home is not bind-mounted)
Well, I am using zfs with ephemeral root which isn't quite the same, but I'll see if that issue may help me to fix this.
@Mauricio Collares That fixed it. What a niche issue; I'm actually surprised you managed to find that. Thank you so much!

Great to hear it's working! It's probably a bug that the "Too many open files" message doesn't show up somewhere in the original lake exe cache get attempt. I wonder if it's an Elan bug when decompressing the tarball (leading to missing oleans) or if it's a Lean bug when using the installed toolchain.
Brian Carbone has marked this topic as resolved.
